info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 12 at 7:39PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF BEAUFORT...CHARLESTON AND COLLETON COUNTIES... At 738 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Ashepoo to near Bennetts Point to near Fripp Island, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 715 PM, a wind gust to 53 mph was observed at the Beaufort Marine Corps Air Station. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include: Beaufort, Port Royal, Edisto Beach, Johns Island, Seabrook Island, Kiawah Island, Meggett, Rockville, Edisto Island, Fripp Island, Bears Bluff, and Parris Island. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
